## Problem
No feedback when actions complete or fail. Users don't know if operations succeeded.

## Requirements

### Toast System
- Success toasts (green): Transaction created, Budget saved, etc.
- Error toasts (red): Failed to save, Network error, etc.
- Info toasts (blue): General notifications

### Implementation Options
- react-native-toast-message
- Custom toast component with context

### Locations
- After transaction create/update/delete
- After budget create/update/delete
- After sharing actions (share, mark paid, decline)
- After profile/settings updates
- On API errors

### Toast Props
- message: string
- type: success | error | info
- duration?: number (default 3s)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Toast system implemented
- [ ] Success toasts on mutations
- [ ] Error toasts on failures
- [ ] Auto-dismiss after duration
- [ ] Can dismiss manually
title: mobile: Implement toast notifications for actions

## Problem
No way to create shared expenses from mobile.

## Requirements

### Screen: ShareExpenseScreen
Modal from SharingScreen FAB

### Form Steps

**Step 1: Expense Details**
- Description (required)
- Total amount (required)
- Date (default today)
- Category picker

**Step 2: Add Participants**
- User lookup by email (GET /api/v1/users/lookup)
- Add multiple participants
- Show participant list

**Step 3: Split Configuration**
- Split type: EQUAL / PERCENTAGE / FIXED
- EQUAL: auto-calculate per person
- PERCENTAGE: input % per person (must sum to 100)
- FIXED: input amount per person (must sum to total)
- Preview split amounts

### Validation
- At least 1 participant
- Split amounts must equal total
- Percentages must sum to 100

### Actions
- Create: calls sharingStore.createSharedExpense
- Cancel: dismisses

## Depends on
- #207 sharingStore
- #182 POST /api/v1/expenses/share
- #188 GET /api/v1/users/lookup

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Multi-step form works
- [ ] User lookup works
- [ ] All split types work
- [ ] Validation prevents invalid splits
- [ ] Creates successfully
title: mobile: Create ShareExpenseScreen with split calculator

## Problem
Onboarding screens exist but selections (currency, categories, budget) are not saved. Users complete onboarding with no data persisted.

## Requirements
Create `mobile/src/stores/onboardingStore.ts` with:

### State
- `selectedCurrency: Currency` (USD | EUR | ILS)
- `selectedCategories: string[]` (category names)
- `monthlyBudget: number | null`
- `currentStep: number`
- `isCompleting: boolean`

### Actions
- `setCurrency(currency)`
- `toggleCategory(name)`
- `setBudget(amount)`
- `nextStep()` / `prevStep()`
- `completeOnboarding()` - calls multiple APIs:
  1. PATCH /api/v1/users/me/currency
  2. POST /api/v1/categories/bulk
  3. POST /api/v1/budgets/quick (if budget set)
  4. POST /api/v1/onboarding/complete
- `skipOnboarding()` - POST /api/v1/onboarding/skip
- `reset()`

## Blocked by
- #198, #199, #200, #201, #202 (onboarding API endpoints)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Store created with Zustand
- [ ] All onboarding screens use this store
- [ ] Data persists to backend on completion
- [ ] Skip works correctly
- [ ] Unit tests added
title: mobile: Create onboardingStore to persist selections

## Description

After Paddle account approval, complete the final integration setup:

### Required Environment Variables

```env
PADDLE_API_KEY=""          # Paddle API key from dashboard
PADDLE_WEBHOOK_SECRET=""   # Webhook secret for signature verification
PADDLE_PRICE_ID=""         # Price ID for $5/month subscription
NEXT_PUBLIC_PADDLE_CLIENT_TOKEN=""   # Client-side token for Paddle.js
NEXT_PUBLIC_PADDLE_ENVIRONMENT="sandbox"  # or "production"
NEXT_PUBLIC_PADDLE_PRICE_ID=""  # Same price ID for client
```

### Paddle Dashboard Setup

1. **Create Product & Price**
   - Create a product for "Balance Beacon Pro"
   - Create a monthly recurring price at $5/month
   - Note the `pri_xxx` price ID

2. **Configure Webhook**
   - Set webhook URL: `https://[your-domain]/api/webhooks/paddle`
   - Enable events:
     - `subscription.created`
     - `subscription.updated`
     - `subscription.canceled`
     - `subscription.activated`
     - `transaction.completed`
     - `transaction.payment_failed`
   - Copy the webhook secret

3. **Get API Keys**
   - Copy API key from Developer Tools
   - Copy client-side token for Paddle.js

### Testing

1. Use sandbox environment first
2. Test checkout flow on `/upgrade` page
3. Verify webhooks are received and processed
4. Test subscription lifecycle (create, cancel, reactivate)

### Related

- PR #163 implements the Paddle integration code
- Webhook handler: `src/app/api/webhooks/paddle/route.ts`
- Checkout page: `src/app/upgrade/`

### Checklist

- [ ] Paddle account approved
- [ ] Product and price created in Paddle dashboard
- [ ] Webhook URL configured with all events
- [ ] Environment variables set in production
- [ ] Sandbox testing completed
- [ ] Production testing completed
